clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Smoking Cessation on Tuberculosis Treatment Outcomes
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Smoking Cessation Interventions on Tuberculosis Treatment Outcomes Among Newly Diagnosed Pulmonary Tuberculosis Patients; a Single Blind Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study was a Randomized Controlled Trial conducted at Ojha Institute of Chest Diseases, Dow University of Health Sciences, Karachi, among pulmonary tuberculosis patients

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A total of three groups, two intervention and one control
study_design_info.masking_description: Outcome assessor for tuberculosis outcomes at the study site were blinded in terms of intervention allocation

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients completing anti-tuberculosis treatment
primary_outcome.description: Among both smear positive and smear negative TB patients, successful completion of ATT will be labeled at the end of 6 months period if the patients has been compliant with ATT through six months period..

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants achieving abstinence from smoking
secondary_outcome.description: Abstinence is defined as staying away from smoking and it will be assessed at week 1, week 4, week 12 and week 24 will be assessed in following two ways: i. Self-reported abstinence using questionnaire ii. Expired carbon monoxide (eCO) levels using Micro Smokerlyzer (Bedfont Scientific) of less than 7 ppm.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients defaulting anti-tuberculosis treatment.
other_outcome.description: Treatment default will be defined as interruption of anti-tuberculosis treatment for â‰¥2 consecutive months. This outcome will be assessed in both smear positive and smear negative patients.

intervention.description: This group received Bupropion 150 mg twice daily for 10 weeks
This group will receive Behavioural Change Communication

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pulmonary tuberculosis patients of age 18 years or above
- registered under Directly Observed Treatment Short course (DOTS) at Ojha Institute of Chest Diseases
- reported to have smoked 100 plus cigarettes in past and currently smoking cigarettes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Extra pulmonary tuberculosis
- drug resistant tuberculosis
- pregnancy
- positive history of epilepsy
